Type.Name: WebException
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents an error that occurs while accessing the Internet through a pluggable protocol.

block.para: is thrown by classes derived from and that implement pluggable protocols when an error occurs in while accessing the Internet.
When is thrown by a method in a class derived from , the property provides the Internet response to the application.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error. This message takes into account the current system culture. The and properties of the new instance are initialized to . The property is initialized to .

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

.property class System.Net.WebResponse Response { public hidebysig specialname instance class System.Net.WebResponse get_Response() }

summary.para: Gets the that the host returned.

value.para: A instance containing the error response if one is available; otherwise, .

para.block: Some Internet protocols, such as HTTP, return otherwise valid responses indicating that an error has occurred at the protocol level. When the response to an Internet request indicates an error, sets the property to and provides the containing the error message in the property of the that was thrown. The can be examined to determine the actual error.

MemberSignature.Value: .property valuetype System.Net.WebExceptionStatus Status { public hidebysig specialname instance valuetype System.Net.WebExceptionStatus get_Status() }

summary.para: Gets a value that indicates the status of the response.

value.para: A value that indicates the status of the response.

remarks.para: The property indicates the reason for the current exception.
The default value for this property is .
